org.jruyi.core

Interface IUdpClientConfiguration


  • public interface IUdpClientConfiguration
    This interface defines methods to configure a UDP client service.
    Since:
    2.2

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void apply()
      Applies this configuration to the associated UDP client service.
      boolean broadcast()
      Returns whether to enable SO_BROADCAST.
      IUdpClientConfiguration broadcast(boolean broadcast)
      Sets true to enable SO_BROADCAST; set false to disable SO_BROADCAST.
      java.lang.String host()
      Returns the hostname or address of remote peer.
      int port()
      Returns the port.
      java.lang.Integer trafficClass()
      Returns the traffic class or type-of-service octet to be set in the IP header, or null if not configured.
      IUdpClientConfiguration trafficClass(java.lang.Integer trafficClass)
      Sets the traffic class or type-of-service octet to be set in the IP header.

    • Method Detail

      • host

        Returns the hostname or address of remote peer.

        Returns the port.

      • trafficClass

        java.lang.Integer trafficClass()
        Returns the traffic class or type-of-service octet to be set in the IP header, or null if not configured.
        Returns:
        the traffic class or type-of-service octet

      • trafficClass

        IUdpClientConfiguration trafficClass(java.lang.Integer trafficClass)
        Sets the traffic class or type-of-service octet to be set in the IP header. Sets null to not configure.
        Parameters:
        trafficClass - the traffic class or type-of-service octet to be set in the IP header
        Returns:
        this configuration

      • broadcast

        boolean broadcast()
        Returns whether to enable SO_BROADCAST.
        Returns:
        true if to enable SO_BROADCAST, otherwise false

      • broadcast

        IUdpClientConfiguration broadcast(boolean broadcast)
        Sets true to enable SO_BROADCAST; set false to disable SO_BROADCAST.
        Parameters:
        broadcast - indicates whether to enable SO_BROADCAST
        Returns:
        this configuration

      • apply

        void apply()
           throws java.lang.Throwable
        Applies this configuration to the associated UDP client service.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if any error happens
